medical_history.chief_complaint: A 9-month-old boy was admitted with fever, diarrhea, and liver failure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until 2 days before admission, when he developed lethargy, irritability, rhinorrhea, intermittent vomiting, and nonbloody diarrhea, with decreased oral intake. His temperature increased to 38.1Â°C the next day, leading to a visit to a health center where he was treated for presumed viral gastroenteritis. Symptoms worsened, prompting admission to the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a respiratory infection one month before admission and bruised his forehead 3 days prior to admission. No other relevant medical history is specified.
medical_history.family_history: The mother had a history of respiratory symptoms for 1 week and had received azithromycin; she had seizures in childhood. No other relevant family history is specified.
medical_history.social_history: The patient did not attend daycare and did not have known travel or toxic exposures, including mushroom ingestion. Social history is otherwise not specified.
